wikipedia_page.main: Roger Wills Hosen (12 June 1933 – 9 April 2005) was an England rugby union player and cricketer.

response: * Roger Hosen, rugby player, born in Mabe, who played rugby for England ten times in the 1960s

Sam Toy, former chairman of Ford of Britain was born here, as was Roger Hosen, the Cornwall and England rugby player. Thomas Tregosse, Puritan minister, sometime Vicar of Mylor and Mabe, was ejected from his benefices for his religious views.

response: ENGLAND: Roger Hosen, Keith Savage, Colin McFadyean, Christopher Jennins, Peter Glover, Richard Sharp (c), Clive Ashby, Phil Judd, George Sherriff, Budge Rogers, Dick Greenwood, Peter Larter, Mike Davis, Stephen Richards, Mike Coulman

*  Roger Hosen – born in Mabe he started career with Penryn before going to play for a number of clubs including Northampton Saints, gaining 10 caps for England. As well as playing rugby union he was also a keen cricketer, representing Cornwall.
